intro: Bernardia lycioides, commonly known as the red-flowered bernardia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of bright red, bell-shaped flowers. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
